message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.DS 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Science sub-category of Network and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) as it proposes a system for network traffic monitoring in Software Defined Networks (SDN). It also discusses the use of SDN control to install, update, and reconstruct monitoring rules in the switch data plane. 

It could also belong to the sub-category of Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) as it addresses the issue of monitoring tasks introducing non-trivial overhead to network devices and proposes a solution that balances measurement load and guarantees system scalability. 

The sub-category of Systems and Control (cs.SY) is also a possibility as the paper proposes a distributed and collaborative monitoring system that utilizes centralized SDN control. 

The sub-category of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) is relevant as the proposed system is distributed and collaborative, and aims to balance measurement load across switches. 

Finally, the sub-category of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) could also be relevant as the paper proposes the use of novel two-stage Bloom filters to represent monitoring rules using small memory space.
